intro: Lepidagathis keralensis, commonly known as Keralan lepidagathis, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as dense forests and undergrowth. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, with five petals and prominent stamens. Lepidagathis keralensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution.
